means: 使（某人）息怒或友好，安抚，劝慰( conciliate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He spoke in a low, nervous, conciliating voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说话时声音低沉、紧张，带着一种安抚的口吻。

sentence.Network_en: Women have more tact. They are more conciliating; they can persuade better.
sentence.Network_cn: 女人更懂得策略, 她们更能赢得别人的同情抚慰, 更善于劝说诱导.

sentence.Network_en: It was a pleasant evening, I said, conciliating the moment.
sentence.Network_cn: 真是个令人愉快的夜晚, 我为了应景助兴说了这么一句话.

list.abs: 如果理事会和议会对某一项立法建议的意见不能达成一致,该建议会被提交到调解委员会(Conciliation Committee),调解委员会拥有和理事会和议会同样多的委员。一旦调解委员.
conciliation act 调停法conciliation proceedings 调解程序conciliation 调和
conchoporphyrin 贝卟啉conciliation act 调停法conciliation proceedings 调解程序
...onciliation board in industrial disputes 劳工纠纷调解委员会conciliation commission 协调委员会【例句】The dispute in the engineering industry is bei.

entry.def: If you conciliate someone, you try to end a disagreement with them.

example.ex: His duty was to conciliate the people, not to provoke them...
example.tran: 他的职责是安抚那些人，而不是去激怒他们。

example.ex: The President has a strong political urge to conciliate...
example.tran: 总统有进行安抚的强烈政治意愿。
